item.title: Report E-2024010399
item.description:
Report E-2024010399

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: CHICAGO
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 16, 2024, one (1) 225-gallon tote of UN2922 was crushed in transit and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the impacted site. HCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the UN2922-impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum to be staged onsite for future disposal. HCE personnel transferred the product from the 255-gallon tote into one (1) 330-gallon tote for further shipment.

item.title: Report E-2024010384
item.description:
Report E-2024010384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-09
  • City: SALEM
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that due to improper loading, approximately 4 gallons of Klean Strip MEK Substitute (hazardous - UN1173) was released. The released product was contained to the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and they felt comfortable cleaning the release donning the proper PPE per SDS. The released product, damaged cans, and oil-dri were placed into a 5 gallon poly drum and staged in OS&D. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report X-2024010384
item.description:
Report X-2024010384

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-10
  • City: ROCKFORD
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A PACKAGE SHOWING SIGNS OF FROST ON THE BOTTOM. UPON INSPECTION OF THE INNER CONTENTS DISCOVERED AN INNER COOLER WITH A CAUTION - DRY ICE MARKING STICKER AND APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE INSIDE COOLING FOOD. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED AIR SERVICE. OUTERMOST BOX DOES HAVE RUSH, PERISHABLE, AND FRAGILE MARKINGS PREPRINTED ON IT. THE PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER E62D38, JAMES P LAWLOR, 58 PERRY ST., EAST WEYMOUTH MA 02189-1414.

item.title: Report E-2024010408
item.description:
Report E-2024010408

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-25T00:35:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-16
  • City: ROCK ISLAND
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Due to a forklift accident, a 55-gallon poly drum containing ChemTreat BL1544 was punctured and released approximately 10-gallons of product onto the concrete, dock floor and asphalt beneath the trailer. A contractor overpacked the damaged drum and neutralized the spilled product with Kolorsafe Base Neutralizer. The spill debris was placed into (2) 55DF's for waste disposal along with the overpack drum. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.
